title: Iron-Rich Foods
description: Focus on iron-rich foods like leafy greens, lentils, and red meat to replenish iron lost during menstruation. This helps combat fatigue and supports energy levels.

title: Gentle Movement
description: Opt for gentle yoga, walking, or stretching. These low-intensity activities can help relieve cramps and boost your mood without depleting your energy.

title: Rest & Reflection
description: Give yourself permission to slow down. This is an ideal time for journaling, meditation, and extra sleep to support your body's natural processes.

title: Build Energy
description: Focus on fresh fruits, sprouted grains, and fish. These foods support increasing estrogen levels and provide sustained energy as your body prepares for ovulation.

title: Cardio & Strength
description: Your energy is rising! This is a great time for more intense workouts like HIIT, running, or strength training. Your body recovers well during this phase.

title: Try New Things
description: As your energy and mood improve, this is an excellent time to socialize, start new projects, or learn new skills. Your cognitive abilities are enhanced.

title: Anti-inflammatory Foods
description: Focus on fresh vegetables, berries, and fatty fish. These foods support hormone balance and can help manage the slight inflammation that occurs during ovulation.

title: High-Intensity Workouts
description: This is your peak energy phase! Challenge yourself with intense workouts like spinning, boxing, or circuit training. Your body is primed for peak performance.

title: Connect & Communicate
description: Your communication skills peak during ovulation. Schedule important meetings, presentations, or social gatherings during this phase for best results.

title: Complex Carbs
description: Include sweet potatoes, brown rice, and oats to support serotonin production and manage PMS symptoms. These foods help stabilize blood sugar and mood.

title: Moderate Movement
description: Switch to moderate exercises like Pilates, cycling, or light jogging. These activities support your changing energy levels without depleting your resources.

title: Organize & Plan
description: Channel pre-menstrual energy into organizing, planning, and completing tasks. Your attention to detail is heightened during this phase.
